//protein Protein is an essential macronutrient, but not all food sources of protein are created equal, and you may not need as much as you think. Learn the basics about protein and shaping your diet with healthy protein foods.

Carbohydrates are macronutrients, meaning they are one of the three main ways the body obtains energy, or calories. Though often maligned in trendy diets, carbohydrates — one of the basic food groups — are important to a healthy diet. Rice is a classic side dish and comfort food and has a place in a healthy diet, but it is definitely high in carbs.

100 grams of rice contain: 

Carbohydrates: 28 grams
Protein: 2.7 grams
Calories: 130 kcal
Fat: 0.2 grams Potatoes are considered a starchy vegetable and a healthy carb. They’re high in fiber, low in calories, and include vitamins and minerals.

100 grams of potatoes contain: 

Carbohydrates: 17 grams
Protein: 2 grams
Calories: 76.7 kcal
Fat: 0.1 grams Bananas are one of the most popular fruits worldwide. They contain essential nutrients that can have a protective impact on health.

100 grams of bananas contain: 

Carbohydrates: 23 grams
Protein: 1.1 grams
Calories: 88.7 kcal

Carbohydrates: 5 grams
Protein: 2.8 grams
Calories: 33.7 kcal
Fat: 0.2 grams Apples are a popular fruit, containing antioxidants, vitamins, dietary fiber, and a range of other nutrients. Due to their varied nutrient content, they may help prevent several health conditions.

Fat is a type of nutrient, and just like protein and carbohydrates, your body needs some fat for energy, to absorb vitamins, and to protect your heart and brain health. For years we’ve been told that eating fat will add inches to your waistline, raise cholesterol, and cause a myriad of health problems. But now we know that not all fat is the same. Oils are not a food group, but they do provide essential nutrients and are therefore included in USDA recommendations for what to eat. Note that only small amounts of oils are recommended.

100 grams of oil contain: 

Fat: 100 grams
Carbohydrates: 0 grams
Protein: 0 grams

Carbohydrates: 1.3 grams

//lose_fat If the goal is to lose weight , the whole thing comes down to calorie intake and calorie expenditure. Our body stores energy from the food we eat, and that energy is spent from different physical activities. So everything we do burns those calories. In order to lose fat we have to be in a calorie deficit. Suppose, Daily we maintain 2500 calorie from eating food and this calorie intake does not affect our weight. So this is our maintenance calorie. 
Now If we want to lose weight our calorie intake has to be less than 2500 cal. 300-500 calorie deficiency can be optimum. 
We can do this by eating less and as well as working out to see faster results.So a good diet and workout plan is essential.
There are few things to keep in mind when dieting for just to lose weight 

1.High protein intake 
2.Less calorie dense food 
3.Foods that are rich in fibre
The food we eat takes energy to digest it in our body. Protein has a higher thermic effect of food, means it will take more energy to process the protein 
so we will be burning more calories by eating more protein. Besides by eating more protein dense foods we easily lose the will of eating so we will never end up binge eating and control our diet. On top of that protein helps to retain muscle mass and more muscles needs more energy to function thus more calories would be burn. 

Checkout our food list at the end of this page to see the most available sources of protein including their macro.
Foods that are high in calorie but has less nutrient values.Even consuming a small amount will cover up your calorie intake greatly but would not make you feel full.There are some calorie dense foods that are healthy like avacado and nuts but people usually ruin their diet by having junk foods like pizza and burgers and french fries. Another enemy of weightloss is Sugar. Foods that contain high sugar should be avoided like soft drink or donuts and cakes. Once in a while consuming these foods can be forgivable but these foods are very adictive so avoiding them is the best option.
Foods that are rich in fibre are filled with imoprtant vitamins but most importantly they are low calorie foods and consuming these foods will make u full easily. These are the green vegetables, lettuce, spinach, broccoli, carrot and also the fruits such as apples,berries,banana etc
When the goal is particularly to lose weight, the best form of exercise is Cardio. The idea is to keep the heartbeat at a higher rate with taking less intervals between every exercise.The rest period of 15-30 secs between every set should be optimum. 

Here are some effective workout routine. 


The Ironhub team is always updating and adding more contents everyday. Its all here and 100% free. Ironhub is the most complete and revolutionary gym management and fitness app. We are always working towards adding more features that will keep your love for fitness alive and well. Send us feedback if you have any questions/comments.
When it comes to gaining muscle the idea is pretty simple, Eat sufficient amount of protein and avoid bad dietary habits. And train your muscles harder than last time.Slowly but surely you will see amazing results After finishing the workout our muscle tissues get damaged.When we rest while sleeping our body repairs those tissues with stronger and larger muscle ones. To do that protein plays the most vital role So we have to keep our diet clean with sufficient amount of protein and train safely and most importantly take rest for recovery
